pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:0.5: 40. The training rule on tooth cleaners
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Vesālī in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.2: At that time a monk who only used discarded things was staying in a charnel ground.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.3: He disliked receiving what was given by people. Instead he would take whatever was offered to the dead at charnel grounds, at the foot of trees, or at thresholds, and he would use that.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.5: “How can this monk take the offerings to our ancestors and use them?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.6: This monk is big and strong. One might even suspect him of eating human flesh!”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.7: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.8: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.9: “How can this monk eat food that hasn’t been given?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.10: “Is it true, monk, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.13: “… Foolish man, how can you eat food that hasn’t been given?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.15: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.16.1: ‘If a monk eats food that has not been given, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.17: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.1: Soon afterwards the monks did not use water or tooth cleaners because they were afraid of wrongdoing.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.2: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.3: “Monks, I allow you to use water and tooth cleaners after taking them yourselves.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.4: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.5.1: ‘If a monk eats food that has not been given, except for water and tooth cleaners, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.6: what has not been received is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.8: standing within arm’s reach of one giving by body or by what is connected to his body or by releasing, he receives it by body or by what is connected to his body—this is called “given”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.10: whatever is edible, apart from water and tooth cleaners—this is called “food”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.11: Except for water and tooth cleaners:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.12: apart from water and tooth cleaners.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.13: If he takes it with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.14: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.1: If it has not been received, and he does not perceive it as received, and he eats it, except for water and tooth cleaners, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.2: If it has not been received, but he is unsure of it, and he eats it, except for water and tooth cleaners, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.3: If it has not been not received, but he perceives it as such, and he eats it, except for water and tooth cleaners, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.4: If it has been received, but he does not perceive it as received, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.5: If it has been received, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.6: If it has been received, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.2: if it is water or tooth cleaners;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.3: if, when there is a reason, but there is no attendant, he himself takes the four filthy edibles and eats them;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.5: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.6: The tenth rule, the training rule on tooth cleaners, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.7: The fourth sub-chapter on eating is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.10: And two on a spoken invitation;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.11: At the wrong time, store, milk,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.12: And with tooth-cleaner—those are the ten.
